revised_title: Introduction to Gamma-Ray Astronomy and Its Developments
tldr: This article discusses the history and development of gamma-ray astronomy, from its beginnings with Hess's discovery of cosmic radiation in 1912 to the launch of the COS-B satellite in 1975. It highlights the detection of gamma-ray lines, the identification of sources, and the use of gamma-rays as a tool for studying cosmic ray distribution in the Galaxy. The article also mentions the potential of gamma-ray bursts and extragalactic objects as areas of future research in high-energy astronomy.
